title: \frametitle (Beamer frame title)
description: Set the title of the current frame. Typically used inside a frame environment.

context.notes: Alternative to frame's title argument.

title: \frontmatter
description: Switch to front matter formatting (roman page numbers, unnumbered chapters). Book/report classes.

context.notes: Place after \begin{document} and before main matter.

title: \gamma (Greek lowercase gamma)
description: Lowercase Greek letter gamma (γ) for math mode.

title: \Gamma (Greek uppercase Gamma)
description: Uppercase Greek letter Gamma (Γ) for math mode.

title: \geq (greater-than or equal)
description: Relational symbol ≥ used in math mode.

title: \gls (use glossary/acronym entry)
description: Print a glossary or acronym entry. For acronyms, the first use prints the long form with short form in parentheses by default; subsequent uses print the short form.

context.notes: Ensure entries are defined and makeglossaries has been run if printing a glossary list.

title: \Gls (capitalized use of entry)
description: Like \gls but capitalizes the first letter (useful at sentence start).

title: \glsaddkey (add custom key to entries, glossaries)
description: Define a new key that can be used in \newglossaryentry key–value lists (advanced customization).

args.name: fieldcmd
args.notes: Command to retrieve the stored field

context.notes: See glossaries manual for defining handlers and retrieval commands.

examples.name: Custom key (conceptual)

custom.notes: Advanced; refer to package manual for exact handler patterns.

title: \glspl (plural use of entry)
description: Like \gls but prints the plural form if available.

context.notes: Define the plural with the 'plural' key in \newglossaryentry or \newacronym if you need irregular plurals.

title: \graphicspath (graphicx)
description: Set a list of directories to search for graphics. Each path must be wrapped in its own braces and end with a slash.

context.notes: Example: \graphicspath{{figures/}{plots/}}. Paths are searched in order when \includegraphics is given without an extension.

custom.notes: Each directory must end with a trailing slash.

title: \hat (math accent)
description: Places a caret accent over its argument in math mode.

context.notes: For wider accents use \widehat.

title: \headrulewidth (header rule thickness, fancyhdr)
description: Control the thickness of the horizontal rule under the header in the 'fancy' pagestyle.

context.notes: Set to 0pt to hide the header rule.

title: \hline
description: Horizontal rule across the entire table width.

context.notes: Place between rows. For high-quality rules, prefer booktabs \toprule/\midrule/\bottomrule.

title: \href (external hyperlink, hyperref)
description: Create a clickable hyperlink to an external URL with custom link text.

context.notes: Use \url{...} if you want the URL itself typeset and line-broken automatically.

placeholders.description: Destination URL (http:, https:, mailto:, doi:, etc.)

title: \hspace / \hspace*
description: Insert horizontal space. The starred form adds space that is not removed at line breaks or in line-start/end positions.

context.notes: Negative values backspace. Without *, space may be ignored at line boundaries.

placeholders.description: Use starred form to prevent removal at line boundaries

title: \hyperref (internal link to \label target, hyperref)
description: Create a clickable link to a labeled target (cross-reference) with custom link text.

context.notes: Target must have a \label (or a \hypertarget). For auto-type naming use \autoref or cleveref.

title: \hypersetup (configure hyperlinks/PDF metadata, hyperref)
description: Set hyperref options, including link colors, PDF metadata (title, author, keywords), and behavior.

keys.name: linkcolor
keys.notes: e.g., blue, black, or an xcolor-defined color

context.notes: Commonly placed in the preamble after \usepackage{hyperref}. Can be used later to adjust settings.

placeholders.defaultText: colorlinks=true, linkcolor=blue, urlcolor=blue, citecolor=blue, pdftitle={Title}, pdfauthor={Author}

examples.name: PDF metadata
examples.code:
\usepackage{hyperref}
\hypersetup{pdftitle={Sample Paper}, pdfauthor={A. U. Thor}, pdfkeywords={topic, keyword}}

custom.notes: Load hyperref as late as possible; if using cleveref, load hyperref before cleveref.

title: \hyphenation (manual hyphenation exceptions)
description: Declare hyphenation exceptions for specific words by inserting hyphens at allowed break points.

context.notes: Hyphenation exceptions are language-specific; issue after loading babel/polyglossia languages.

title: \ifthenelse (conditional, ifthen pkg)
description: Conditional branching with boolean tests, string comparisons, counter tests, and length comparisons.

context.notes: For complex logic, consider etoolbox or LaTeX3 expl3 conditionals.

custom.notes: Use \newboolean and \setboolean with ifthen for custom flags.

title: \iint (double integral, amsmath)
description: Double integral operator from amsmath (see also \iiint, \idotsint).

context.notes: Use \iiint for triple integrals; \idotsint for dotted multi-integrals.

title: \in (set membership)
description: Relational symbol ∈ used in math mode.

title: \include
description: Include another file at a page break. Only for the main document body (not the preamble).

context.notes: Starts and ends with a clear page; useful for chapters.

placeholders.description: Base name of the included file (no .tex extension)

title: \includegraphics (graphicx)
description: Insert an external graphic. Supports scaling, sizing, trimming, rotation, and page selection (PDF).

keys.name: trim
keys.notes: l b r t lengths, e.g., 1cm 2pt 1cm 0

keys.name: viewport
keys.notes: llx lly urx ury in bp

context.notes: Use clip along with trim to crop content. Graphic file extension may be omitted if \DeclareGraphicsExtensions is set.

title: \includeonly
description: Restrict \include to a specified list of files. Preamble-only.

context.notes: List file basenames separated by commas; no .tex extension.

title: \indent
description: Force indentation at the start of the paragraph.

context.notes: Place at the start of a paragraph to insert a parindent.

examples.name: Force indent
examples.code: \indent This paragraph starts with an indent.

title: \index (add index entry, makeidx)
description: Add an entry to the document index. Supports subentries with !, formatting with @, and special sorting keys with |.

args.name: entry
args.notes: Use ! for subentry, @ for printed form, | for formatting or seealso

context.notes: Avoid using in moving arguments (e.g., section titles) unless protected (\protect).

custom.notes: Multiple \index commands can be combined with \index{alpha|see{beta}}.

title: \infty (infinity)
description: Symbol ∞ used in math mode.

title: \input
description: Insert the contents of another file at this point. Works in preamble or body.

context.notes: File extension is optional; .tex is assumed.

title: \inputminted (include highlighted file, minted)
description: Include and highlight a source file using Pygments. Requires -shell-escape.

packages.name: minted
packages.reason: Provides \inputminted for file inclusion with highlighting

context.notes: Compile with -shell-escape. For reproducible builds, consider minted's cache options.

custom.notes: If shell escape is disabled, listings is a robust alternative.

title: \int (integral)
description: Integral operator with optional limits; commonly written with thin space before differential.

context.notes: Use \limits or \nolimits to control limit placement.

title: \iota (Greek lowercase iota)
description: Lowercase Greek letter iota (ι) for math mode.

title: \item
description: Start a list item. Optional custom label in brackets; required inside list environments.

args.name: text
args.notes: Item content follows; the braces here are a snippet convenience.

context.notes: Valid inside itemize, enumerate, or description.

title: \kappa (Greek lowercase kappa)
description: Lowercase Greek letter kappa (κ) for math mode.

title: \KwData (algorithm2e: input specification)
description: Declare the input data for an algorithm (algorithm2e). Typically placed near the top of the algorithm.

context.notes: Use inside the algorithm2e environment.

title: \KwResult (algorithm2e: output specification)
description: Declare the result/output of an algorithm (algorithm2e).

context.notes: Use inside the algorithm2e environment.

title: \label (set cross-reference label)
description: Defines a label to reference later with \ref, \pageref, \nameref, \vref, or \cref. Typically placed right after a \caption or a sectional command.

context.notes: Place the label after the counter-advancing command, e.g., after \section{...} or \caption{...}. Rerun LaTeX to resolve references.

title: \lambda (Greek lowercase lambda)
description: Lowercase Greek letter lambda (λ) for math mode.

title: \Lambda (Greek uppercase Lambda)
description: Uppercase Greek letter Lambda (Λ) for math mode.

context.notes: Commonly a set, eigenvalue, or cosmological constant symbol.

title: \leftrightarrow (double-headed arrow)
description: Arrow ↔ used for equivalence/bi-implication in math mode.

context.notes: Double-lined version: \Leftrightarrow.

title: \leq (less-than or equal)
description: Relational symbol ≤ used in math mode.

title: \linebreak
description: Request a line break with optional strength 0–4 (4 = do it).

context.notes: Use sparingly; LaTeX will handle line breaks automatically in most cases.

title: \listoffigures
description: Generate the list of figures.

context.notes: Needs multiple runs.

title: \listoftables
description: Generate the list of tables.

context.notes: Needs multiple runs.

title: \lstinputlisting (include code file, listings)
description: Include the contents of a source file as a formatted listing.

title: \lstset (configure listings defaults)
description: Set default options for all subsequent listings and lstlisting environments.

context.notes: Place in preamble to affect the entire document.

title: \mainmatter
description: Switch to main matter formatting (arabic page numbers, numbered chapters). Book/report classes.

context.notes: Use after \frontmatter (if present).

title: \makebox
description: Make a box of specified width and alignment; optionally stretch contents.

title: \makeglossaries (prepare glossaries build)
description: Write auxiliary files and mark that glossaries should be built. Requires running the external 'makeglossaries' tool (or makeindex/xindy) and recompiling.

context.notes: Typical sequence: LaTeX → makeglossaries (or makeindex/xindy) → LaTeX.

custom.notes: latexmk can automate this with add_cus_dep or glossaries support.

title: \makeindex (enable indexing, makeidx)
description: Enable index creation in the document by preparing the .idx file and definitions for \index and \printindex.

context.notes: Place in the preamble. Build sequence: LaTeX → makeindex (or makeglossaries) → LaTeX.

title: \maketitle
description: Typeset the title block using \title, \author, and \date. Use after \begin{document}.

context.notes: Usually placed near the start of the document body.

title: \marginpar (core margin note)
description: Print a short note in the margin; optional argument sets text for the left margin (two-sided documents).

context.notes: Placement may be adjusted by the class; avoid long content.

title: \@cmd@ Math font switches
description: Switch math font family/style for symbols: \mathrm, \mathbf, \mathit, \mathsf, \mathtt, \mathnormal, \boldsymbol.

title: \mbox
description: Create an unbreakable box (prevents line breaks).

context.notes: Use to keep short phrases together.

title: \mediumspace Medium space (\:)
description: Inserts a medium space. Works in math and text; typically used in math.

title: \microtypesetup (microtype: set microtypography options)
description: Locally or globally set options for microtypography (e.g., protrusion, expansion, tracking, letterspacing).

context.notes: Use in the preamble for global effect, or inside a group for local changes.

examples.name: Disable protrusion locally
examples.code: {\microtypesetup{protrusion=false} Text with no margin kerning here.}

custom.notes: Some features depend on font encodings and engine support.

title: \midrule (booktabs)
description: Mid table rule (booktabs).

title: \mu (Greek lowercase mu)
description: Lowercase Greek letter mu (μ) for math mode.

title: \multicolumn
description: Make one cell span multiple columns, with its own alignment and column formatting.

context.notes: Use within a row; counts as one cell.

title: \multirow (multirow)
description: Create a cell that spans multiple rows.

context.notes: Combine with \multicolumn if needed to handle vertical rules.

title: \nabla (del operator)
description: Vector differential operator ∇ used in math mode.

title: \nameref (name/title reference)
description: Insert the title/name of the labeled object (e.g., section title). Provided by nameref or hyperref.

context.notes: Use with labels attached to objects that have titles/captions.

title: \negthinspace Negative thin space (\!)
description: Inserts a negative thin space. Works in math and text; used for fine adjustment.

title: \neq (not equal)
description: Relational symbol ≠ used in math mode.

title: \newacronym (define acronym, glossaries)
description: Define an acronym entry with label, short form, and long form. First \gls usage prints long (short) by default; subsequent uses print short form.

context.notes: You can customize first and subsequent formats with package options or \\glsset.

title: \newcommand (define macro)
description: Define a new macro with an optional number of arguments (0–9) and an optional default value for the first argument.

context.notes: Starred form defines a ‘short’ command (no paragraph breaks in arguments). Prefer preamble for stable definitions.

title: \newcounter (define counter)
description: Create a new counter, optionally resetting it when another counter is incremented.

args.name: within
args.notes: Reset when this counter increments (e.g., section)

context.notes: Use \the<name> to define a printed representation if desired.

title: \NewDocumentCommand (xparse: define macro)
description: Define a macro with an argument specification using LaTeX3’s xparse. Supports rich argument types (m, O{default}, o, d<delims>, s, t<char>, g, G{default}, r(), R()...).

args.name: definition
args.notes: Arguments accessed via #1..#n; starred/optional tokens via \IfBooleanTF, etc.

packages.name: xparse
packages.reason: Provides \NewDocumentCommand and related interfaces (bundled with LaTeX since 2020)

context.notes: Common specifiers: m (mandatory), O{def} (optional w/ default), o (optional), s (star), t<char> (toggle), d<><> (delimited), g/G{def} (general optional).

title: \NewDocumentEnvironment (xparse: define environment)
description: Define a new environment using xparse with an argument specification and separate begin/end code.

context.notes: Supports rich argument parsing for environments. Use \RenewDocumentEnvironment to redefine.

title: \newenvironment (define environment)
description: Define a new environment with optional arguments. Provide begin- and end-code parts.

context.notes: Starred form creates a short environment (no paragraph breaks in arguments).

title: \newfontfamily (fontspec: define a font-switch command)
description: Define a new command that selects a specific font family (with features). XeLaTeX/LuaLaTeX only.

packages.name: fontspec
packages.reason: Provides \newfontfamily for custom font family commands

context.notes: Use the created command to switch fonts locally: {\brandfont Text}.

title: \newgeometry (change page geometry mid-document, geometry)
description: Temporarily change page layout parameters (margins, paper size, etc.) from the point of invocation. Use \restoregeometry to revert.

context.notes: Common use: set temporary margins for a title page or a wide figure page.

custom.notes: Prefer geometry over manual \setlength of layout parameters for reliability.

title: \newglossaryentry (define glossary entry, glossaries)
description: Define a glossary entry with keys such as name and description. Build with makeglossaries or makeindex/xindy.

context.notes: Run makeglossaries (or makeindex/xindy) and recompile to generate the glossary.

title: \newlength (define length register)
description: Create a new length register for later use with \setlength or \addtolength.

title: \newline
description: End the current line. Similar to \\ but without optional extra vertical space.

title: \newpage
description: Start a new page immediately.

context.notes: Unlike \clearpage, this does not flush floats.

title: \newtheorem (define theorem-like environment, amsthm)
description: Define a theorem-like environment. Supports numbering within another counter, sharing numbering with an existing environment, and an unnumbered starred form.

context.notes: Combine with \theoremstyle{plain|definition|remark} to control formatting.

custom.notes: Define all theorem-like environments in the preamble for consistent numbering.

title: \node (TikZ node)
description: Create a node for labels/shapes. Can be placed at coordinates, given a name, styled, and used as anchors for edges.

context.notes: Node may also be used inline on paths: \draw ... node[pos=0.5,above]{text};

custom.notes: When used inline on a path, omit 'at (...)' and give pos=..., near start/end, etc.

title: \noindent
description: Suppress indentation of the next paragraph.

context.notes: Place at the start of a paragraph to remove indentation once.

examples.name: No indent
examples.code: \noindent This paragraph starts at the margin.

title: \nolinebreak
description: Discourage or prohibit a line break here with optional strength 0–4 (4 = forbid).
